TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LookupTable extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientObject

example.para: The following code example is a console application that queries the collection of lookup tables in a Project Web App instance and displays information about the code masks and entries for a specified lookup table. The projLutCollection variable is a LookupTableCollection object.
For example, suppose the Department lookup table contains the following code masks and lookup table values:
example.code: Sequence Length Separator _______________________________________________ Characters Any . Uppercase Letters 2 .
Level Value ______________________________ 1 Test Dept 1 1 Test Dept 2 1 Test Dept C 2 CA 2 CB
example.para: Following is the output of the ReadLookupTable application (the GUIDs for your entries would be different).

Note: Because the Department lookup table is built-in, the GUID of the Department lookup table is the same in all Project Web App instances. The GUID is the value of the Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.LookupTables.DEPARTMENTS_LT_UID field.
example.code:
'Department' lookup table Id: e7397277-1ab0-4096-b2dd-57029a055ba4 Field type: TEXT
Number of 'Department' lookup table masks: 2
MaskType: CHARACTERS Length: 0 Separator: . MaskType: UPPERCASE Length: 2 Separator: .
Number of 'Department' lookup table entries: 5
bbc07ff5-b06d-e211-93f4-0021704e28a0, SortIndex: 1 FullValue: Test Dept 1
bcc07ff5-b06d-e211-93f4-0021704e28a0, SortIndex: 2 FullValue: Test Dept 2
bdc07ff5-b06d-e211-93f4-0021704e28a0, SortIndex: 3 FullValue: Test Dept C
0a6ef8d8-6871-e211-93f4-0021704e28a0, SortIndex: 4 FullValue: Test Dept C.CA
0b6ef8d8-6871-e211-93f4-0021704e28a0, SortIndex: 5 FullValue: Test Dept C.CB
Press any key to exit...

public: property Guid AppAlternateId { Guid get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the alternate lookup table GUID that is specified in an App package for Project Online.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DeleteObject() cil managed
Public ReadOnly Property Entries As LookupEntryCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of entries in the lookup table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FieldType As CustomFieldType

Docs.summary: Gets the custom field type that matches the values in the lookup table.
Docs.value: A numerical value that represents the field type.

remarks.para: Field types include Cost, Date, FinishDate, Duration, Flag, Number, and Text.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Id As Guid
public: property Guid Id { Guid get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the GUID of the lookup table.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override bool InitOnePropertyFromJson (string peekedName, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.JsonReader reader);

Docs.param: The name of the property to initialize.
The JsonReader object that initializes the property value from the JSON data.
Docs.returns: True if the property is initialized; otherwise, False.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Masks As IEnumerable(Of LookupMask)

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of mask definitions for the levels of a hierarchical lookup table.
Docs.value: An enumerator that supports an iteration over a collection of LookupMask objects.

remarks.para: All lookup tables must have at least one mask, and only text tables may have more than one mask.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Name : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the lookup table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::ProjectServer::Client::LookupTableSortOrder SortOrder { Microsoft::ProjectServer::Client::LookupTableSortOrder get(); void set(Microsoft::ProjectServer::Client::LookupTableSortOrder value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the sort-order for the entries in the table.
Docs.value: A numerical value that represents the sort order.

remarks.para: Examples of sort order include custom, ascending, and descending order.
